revised_title: The Swelling of Charcoal: Saturation and Immersion Expansions and the Heat of Wetting
tldr: This article investigates the swelling of charcoal and its behavior when wetted by a liquid. The authors find that the saturation expansion of charcoal differs from the immersional value, which affects the heat of wetting. They also explore the implications of these findings on the structure of charcoal and its hygrometric properties.
